sen.j: 小田 為綱（おだ ためつな、天保10年（1839年） - 明治34年（1901年））は、岩手県九戸郡宇部村(現：久慈市宇部町)出身の学者・教育者・政治家。
sen.e: Tametsuna ODAO (1839 - 1901) was a scholar/educator/statesman coming from Ube-mura Kunohe-gun (now Ube-machi Kuji City), Iwate Prefecture.
Tametsuna ODA (1839 - 1901) was a scholar and educator and statesman coming from Ube Village, Kunohe County (present Ube-cho, Kuji City), Iwate Prefecture.

sen.j: 昌平黌に学んだ後、盛岡藩の藩校である作人館の教授・寮長となり、原敬らを指導する。
sen.e: After learning at Shoheiko he became a professor/housemaster of Sakujinkan, a hanko (domain school) of the Morioka Domain, and instructed Takashi HARA and others.
After learning at Shoheiko (Shohei-zaka Gakumon-jo), he became a professor and dormitory superintendent of Sakujinkan, a domain school of the Morioka Domain, and instructed Takashi HARA and others.

sen.j: 明治維新後、北奥羽開拓の構想を建白するが顧みられなかった。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration he submitted a scheme of reclaiming Northern Ou region, but no attention was paid.

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）の西南戦争に呼応して、東北地方での士族挙兵の計画に参画するが未然に検挙され（首謀者の神職の名から「真田太古事件」と呼ばれる）、他の参加者らとともに禁固刑に処せられた。
sen.e: Acting in concert with Seinan War in 1877, he participated in a project of raising an army by shizoku (families or persons with samurai ancestors) in Tohoku Region, but was arrested before it happened (which was called "Sanada Taiko Jiken (incidence) " after the name of a ringleader, a Shinto priest), and as a result he and other members were given a penalty of kinko-kei (imprisonment without work).

Following the Seinan War in 1877, he joined the group planning raising a samurai army in Tohoku region, however, before the action, he was arrested and imprisoned as well as the other followers (the incident has been called 'Sanada Taiko Jiken' after the name of the ringleader who was a Shinto priest).

sen.j: 明治31年（1898年）には衆議院議員に当選するが、任期中の明治34年(1901年)に没した。
sen.e: In 1898, he won a seat in the House of Representatives, however, he died during his term of office in 1901.

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）から翌年にかけて作成されたとされる「憲法草稿評林」は、民権論的な私擬憲法として注目される。
sen.e: Kenpo Soko Hyorin" that he prepared from 1880 to the next year attracted attention as a democratic shigi (privately-drafted) Constitution..
Kenpo Soko Hyorin' is considered to have written by him from 1880 to 1881 and to be important as a privately-drafted constitution advocating the people's rights.
